intro: [WRONG START] Astellia stylosa, commonly known as the slender flax lily, is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Astelia stylosa is typically found in forested areas and is adapted to grow in shaded, moist conditions.
